other_tests.findings: Revealed early germ cells, prominent perilobular hyalinization, small foci of sclerosis, and no evidence for spermatogenesis. Mild Leydig cell hyperplasia was present.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Neurological abnormalities progressed, with an unsteady gait, worsened dysarthria, and a more withdrawn personality.

other_tests.findings: The LH level rose from a basal value of 0.06 IU/liter to a peak level of 5.80 IU/liter at 90 min. The FSH level rose from a baseline value of 0.14 IU/liter to a peak of 2.0 IU/liter at 120 min.
XI:4 was able to recognize 10 of 12 items but had only a 39% accuracy over 41 trials.

Revealed diffuse parenchymal volume loss, particularly involving the cerebellar hemispheres and vermis; Multiple punctate and confluent areas of T2 hyperintensity noted in the periventricular and subcortical white matter bilaterally.
Showed type IIB hyperlipidemia (elevated low-density lipoprotein and very-low-density lipoprotein).
